About.Name: Shewit Yonas
About.AboutText:
Hi, I’m Shewit Yonas, a Mechanical Engineering student at Seattle Pacific University with a strong passion for engineering design, problem-solving, and hands-on technical work. I am particularly interested in CAD design, mechanical systems, and engineering analysis, and I enjoy applying engineering principles to real-world challenges.

With experience working as an engineering intern, an academic tutor, and a student project designer, I have developed a strong foundation in communication, teamwork, and technical design. I thrive in collaborative project environments where I can contribute practical solutions, learn advanced tools, and grow both technically and professionally.

Outside of academics, I enjoy working on multidisciplinary engineering projects, from prototyping mechanical systems to developing performance models in MATLAB. I am committed to continuous learning, expanding my skillset, and pursuing opportunities that integrate mechanical design, sustainability, and innovation.

Experience.ExperienceText: I have built experience across engineering design, CAD modeling, environmental projects, and academic support roles. I enjoy combining technical ability with communication and leadership, and I am actively growing my engineering skillset through internships and hands-on design work.
Experience.EducationText: My engineering education includes coursework in system dynamics, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, CAD, heat transfer, and mechanical design. I maintain a 3.95 GPA and received the Full Tuition Distinguished Scholar Award.
Experience.EmploymentText: At Furtado & Associates, I produced 50+ 2D and 3D CAD drawings from land survey data using AutoCAD. Drafted and QC-checked parcel maps for Sound Transit Light Rail expansion. Researched legal records and wrote legal descriptions for Sound Transit's land acquisitions.
At the South Seattle College Writing Center, I tutored ELL students, coordinated tutor schedules, and developed targeted writing improvement plans across multiple academic subjects.

At the Port of Seattle, I helped plan an educational program teaching teens about environmental initiatives and Green Jobs careers, participated in environmental restoration work, led meetings, and conducted career development interviews.
Experience.SkillsText: My technical strengths include mechanical design, CAD modeling, engineering calculations, MATLAB simulation, and technical documentation.

Project1.Title: SoulUmbra — Semi-Autonomous Solar Energy Robot
Project1.Desc: Co-developing a solar energy collection robot featuring a retractable solar panel array and an actuator-driven lifting system. Responsible for CAD modeling, mechanism development, and motor selection...

Project2.Title: Prosthetic Hand Prototype
Project2.Desc: Designed and 3D-printed a functional prosthetic hand prototype including a palm housing, motor mounts, and a full linkage system for natural finger curling and thumb rotation...

Project3.Title: Water-Cooled Air Conditioner Prototype & MATLAB Performance Model
Project3.Desc: Built and tested a water-cooled AC prototype using a fan, copper tubing, pump, and ice bath. Developed a MATLAB model to calculate heat transfer rate, convection coefficients, and system performance...

Project4.Title: NSBE Leadership — Vice President
Project4.Desc: Lead weekly professional development meetings for 20 members, coordinated industry events, and represented NSBE on the STEM Student Council...
